info.title: Marketing Marketing Events
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: You have an external system that handles registration for your webinars and you want to ensure that attendee data and behavior is synced with your HubSpot CRM.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: A marketing event is a CRM object, similar to contacts and companies, that enables you to track marketing events, such as a webinar, along with the contacts who registered and attended the event. Below, learn more about working with the marketing event API to integrate marketing events into an app.

get.summary: Read participations breakdown by Marketing Event internal identifier
get.description: Read Marketing event's participations breakdown with optional filters by internal identifier marketingEventId.

parameters.name: marketingEventId
parameters.description: The internal id of the marketing event in HubSpot.

parameters.name: contactIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the Contact. It may be email or internal id.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The participation state value. It may be REGISTERED, CANCELLED, ATTENDED, NO_SHOW

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit for response size. The default value is 10, the max number is 100

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor indicating the position of the last retrieved item.

post.summary: Record Participants by ContactId with Marketing Event External Ids
post.description:
Records the participation of multiple HubSpot contacts in a Marketing Event using their HubSpot contact IDs.

Additional Functionality:
- Adds a timeline event to the contacts.

Allowed Properties:
For the state "attend":
- joinedAt
- leftAt

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application

parameters.name: subscriberState
parameters.description: The new subscriber state for the HubSpot contacts and the specified marketing event. For example: 'register', 'attend' or 'cancel'.

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application

post.summary: Record a subscriber state by contact ID
post.description: Record a subscriber state between multiple HubSpot contacts and a marketing event, using HubSpot contact IDs. Note that the contact must already exist in HubSpot; a contact will not be created.

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application

parameters.name: subscriberState
parameters.description: The new subscriber state for the HubSpot contacts and the specified marketing event. For example: 'register', 'attend' or 'cancel'.

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application

get.summary: Get Marketing Event by External IDs
get.description:
Returns the details of a Marketing Event with the specified externalAccountId, externalEventId, if it exists.

Only Marketing Events created by the same app making the request can be retrieved.

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application

put.summary: Create or update a marketing event
put.description: Upserts a marketing event If there is an existing marketing event with the specified ID, it will be updated; otherwise a new event will be created.

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application

delete.summary: Delete Marketing Event by External Ids
delete.description:
Deletes the existing Marketing Event with the specified externalAccountId, externalEventId, if it exists.

Only Marketing Events created by the same app can be deleted.

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application

patch.summary: Update Marketing Event by External IDs
patch.description:
Updates the details of an existing Marketing Event identified by its externalAccountId, externalEventId if it exists.

Only Marketing Events created by the same app can be updated.

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application

post.summary: Create or Update Multiple Marketing Events
post.description:
Upserts multiple Marketing Events. If a Marketing Event with the specified ID already exists, it will be updated; otherwise, a new event will be created.

Only Marketing Events originally created by the same app can be updated.

post.summary: Record Participants by Email with Marketing Event External Ids
post.description:
Records the participation of multiple HubSpot contacts in a Marketing Event using their email addresses.

If a contact does not exist, it will be automatically created. The contactProperties field is used exclusively for creating new contacts and will not update properties of existing contacts.

Additional Functionality:
- Adds a timeline event to the contacts.

Allowed Properties:
For the state "attend":
- joinedAt
- leftAt

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application

parameters.name: subscriberState
parameters.description: The new subscriber state for the HubSpot contacts and the specified marketing event. For example: 'register', 'attend' or 'cancel'.

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application

get.summary: Read participations breakdown by Marketing Event external identifier
get.description: Read Marketing event's participations breakdown with optional filters by externalAccountId and externalEventId pair.

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application.

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

parameters.name: contactIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the Contact. It may be email or internal id.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The participation state value. It may be REGISTERED, CANCELLED, ATTENDED, NO_SHOW

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit for response size. The default value is 10, the max number is 100

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor indicating the position of the last retrieved item.

get.description: Returns the details of a Marketing Event with the specified objectId, if it exists.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The internal ID of the marketing event in HubSpot

delete.description: Deletes the existing Marketing Event with the specified objectId, if it exists.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The internal ID of the marketing event in HubSpot

patch.description: Updates the details of an existing Marketing Event identified by its objectId, if it exists.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The internal ID of the marketing event in HubSpot

get.summary: Get lists associated with a marketing event
get.description: Gets lists associated with a marketing event by external account id and external event id

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

get.summary: Get lists associated with a marketing event
get.description: Gets lists associated with a marketing event by marketing event id

parameters.name: marketingEventId
parameters.description: The internal id of the marketing event in HubSpot.

post.summary: Record Participants by Email with Marketing Event Object Id
post.description:
Records the participation of multiple HubSpot contacts in a Marketing Event using their email addresses.

If a contact does not exist, it will be automatically created. The contactProperties field is used exclusively for creating new contacts and will not update properties of existing contacts.

Additional Functionality:
- Adds a timeline event to the contacts.

Allowed Properties:
For the state "attend":
- joinedAt
- leftAt

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The internal ID of the marketing event in HubSpot

parameters.name: subscriberState
parameters.description: The attendance state value. It may be 'register', 'attend' or 'cancel'

get.description:
Returns all Marketing Events available on the portal, along with their properties, regardless of whether they were created manually or through the application.

The marketing events returned by this endpoint are sorted by objectId.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor indicating the position of the last retrieved item.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit for response size. The default value is 10, the max number is 100

post.summary: Record Participants by ContactId with Marketing Event Object Id
post.description:
Records the participation of multiple HubSpot contacts in a Marketing Event using their HubSpot contact IDs.

Additional Functionality:
- Adds a timeline event to the contacts.

Allowed Properties:
For the state "attend":
- joinedAt
- leftAt

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The internal id of the marketing event in HubSpot

parameters.name: subscriberState
parameters.description: The attendance state value. It may be 'register', 'attend' or 'cancel'

post.summary: Update Multiple Marketing Events by ObjectId
post.description: Updates multiple Marketing Events on the portal based on their objectId, if they exist.

post.summary: Delete Multiple Marketing Events by ObjectId
post.description:
Deletes multiple Marketing Events from the portal based on their objectId, if they exist.

Responses:
204: Returned if all specified Marketing Events were successfully deleted.
207: Returned if some objectIds did not correspond to any existing Marketing Events.

get.summary: Read participations counters by Marketing Event external identifier
get.description: Read Marketing event's participations counters by externalAccountId and externalEventId pair.

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application.

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

get.summary: Find Marketing Events by External Event Id
get.description:
This endpoint searches the portal for all Marketing Events whose externalEventId matches the value provided in the request.

It retrieves the objectId and additional event details for each matching Marketing Event.

Since multiple Marketing Events can have the same externalEventId, the endpoint returns all matching results.

Note: Marketing Events become searchable by externalEventId a few minutes after creation.

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

get.summary: Read participations counters by Marketing Event internal identifier
get.description: Read Marketing event's participations counters by internal identifier marketingEventId.

parameters.name: marketingEventId
parameters.description: The internal id of the marketing event in HubSpot.

post.summary: Delete Multiple Marketing Events by External Ids
post.description:
Deletes multiple Marketing Events based on externalAccountId, externalEventId, and appId.

Only Marketing Events created by the same apps will be deleted; events from other apps cannot be removed by this endpoint.

post.summary: Mark a marketing event as cancelled
post.description: Mark a marketing event as cancelled.

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application

put.summary: Associate a list with a marketing event
put.description: Associates a list with a marketing event by marketing event id and ILS list id

parameters.name: marketingEventId
parameters.description: The internal id of the marketing event in HubSpot.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The ILS ID of the list.

delete.summary: Disassociate a list from a marketing event
delete.description: Disassociates a list from a marketing event by marketing event id and ILS list id

parameters.name: marketingEventId
parameters.description: The internal id of the marketing event in HubSpot.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The ILS ID of the list.

post.summary: Record a subscriber state by contact email
post.description: Record a subscriber state between multiple HubSpot contacts and a marketing event, using contact email addresses. Note that the contact must already exist in HubSpot; a contact will not be created. The contactProperties field is used only when creating a new contact. These properties will not update existing contacts.

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application

parameters.name: subscriberState
parameters.description: The new subscriber state for the HubSpot contacts and the specified marketing event. For example: 'register', 'attend' or 'cancel'.

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application

post.summary: Mark a marketing event as completed
post.description: Mark a marketing event as completed

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application.

put.summary: Associate a list with a marketing event
put.description: Associates a list with a marketing event by external account id, external event id, and ILS list id

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application.

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

parameters.name: listId

delete.summary: Disassociate a list from a marketing event
delete.description: Disassociates a list from a marketing event by external account id, external event id, and ILS list id

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application.

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The ILS ID of the list.

post.description: Creates a new marketing event in HubSpot

get.summary: Read participations breakdown by Contact identifier
get.description: Read Contact's participations by identifier - email or internal id.

parameters.name: contactIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the Contact. It may be email or internal id.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The participation state value. It may be REGISTERED, CANCELLED, ATTENDED, NO_SHOW

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit for response size. The default value is 10, the max number is 100

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor indicating the position of the last retrieved item.

get.description: Retrieve the current settings for the application.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The id of the application to retrieve the settings for.

post.description: Create or update the current settings for the application.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The id of the application to update the settings for.

get.summary: Find App-Specific Marketing Events by External Event Id
get.description:
Retrieves Marketing Events where the externalEventId matches the value provided in the request, limited to events created by the app making the request.

Marketing Events created by other apps will not be included in the results.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application (externalEventId)

registrants.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that registered for this marketing event.

eventOrganizer.description: The name of the organizer of the marketing event.

eventUrl.description: A URL in the external event application where the marketing event can be managed.

attendees.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that attended this marketing event.

eventType.description: The type of the marketing event.

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the marketing event.

noShows.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that registered for this marketing event, but did not attend. This field only had a value when the event is over.

cancellations.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that registered for this marketing event, but later cancelled their registration.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event.

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

eventCancelled.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been cancelled.

externalEventId.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

eventDescription.description: The description of the marketing event.

eventName.description: The name of the marketing event.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

email.description: The email address of the contact in HubSpot to associate with the event.

interactionDateTime.description: Timestamp in milliseconds at which the contact subscribed to the event.

externalAccountId.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application.

externalEventId.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

appId.description: The id of the application that created the marketing event in HubSpot.

sourceId.description: The ID of the property source indicating where it was created.

selectedByUser.description: Whether the value was selected by a user.

source.description: The origin of the property value, such as "IMPORT" or "API".

updatedByUserId.description: The ID of the user who updated the property.

sourceMetadata.description: Source metadata encoded as a base64 string. For example: `ZXhhbXBsZSBzdHJpbmc=`

dataSensitivity.description: The sensitivity level of the property, such as "non_sensitive", "sensitive", and "highly_sensitive".

sourceVid.description: The unique identifier associated with the source.

unit.description: The unit of measurement or context for the value.

requestId.description: A unique ID associated with this request.

isEncrypted.description: Whether the property value is encrypted.

selectedByUserTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the value was selected by a user, if applicable.

timestamp.description: When the value was set, as a 64-bit integer.

PropertyValue.description: Represents a single custom property of a marketing event, storing its name, value, metadata (like source, timestamp, and sensitivity), and related audit information for tracking changes.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event.

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

eventCancelled.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been cancelled. Defaults to `false`

eventOrganizer.description: The name of the organizer of the marketing event.

eventUrl.description: A URL in the external event application where the marketing event can be managed.

eventDescription.description: The description of the marketing event.

eventName.description: The name of the marketing event.

eventType.description: Describes what type of event this is.  For example: `WEBINAR`, `CONFERENCE`, `WORKSHOP`

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the marketing event.

eventOrganizer.description: The name of the organizer of the marketing event.

eventUrl.description: A URL in the external event application where the marketing event can be managed.

eventType.description: The type of the marketing event.

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the marketing event.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event.

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

eventCancelled.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been cancelled.

eventDescription.description: The description of the marketing event.

eventName.description: The name of the marketing event.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event.

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

eventCancelled.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been cancelled.

eventOrganizer.description: The name of the organizer of the marketing event.

eventUrl.description: The URL in the external event application where the marketing event can be managed.

eventDescription.description: The description of the marketing event.

eventName.description: The name of the marketing event.

eventType.description: The type of the marketing event.

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the marketing event.

inputs.description: List of HubSpot contacts to subscribe to the marketing event

subCategory.description: A more specific error category within each main category.

context.description: Additional context-specific information related to the error.

links.description: URLs linking to documentation or resources associated with the error.

id.description: A unique ID for the error instance.

category.description: The main category of the error.

message.description: A human-readable string describing the error and possible remediation steps.

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event.

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

externalAccountId.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application.

eventCancelled.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been cancelled.  Defaults to `false`

eventOrganizer.description: The name of the organizer of the marketing event.

eventUrl.description: A URL in the external event application where the marketing event can be managed.

externalEventId.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

eventDescription.description: The description of the marketing event.

eventName.description: The name of the marketing event.

eventType.description: Describes what type of event this is.  For example: `WEBINAR`, `CONFERENCE`, `WORKSHOP`

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the marketing event.

appId.description: The id of the application the settings are for

eventDetailsUrl.description: The url that will be used to fetch marketing event details by id

interactionDateTime.description: Timestamp in milliseconds at which the contact subscribed to the event.

eventDetailsUrl.description: The url that will be used to fetch marketing event details by id. Must contain a `%s` character sequence that will be substituted with the event id. For example: `https://my.event.app/events/%s`

inputs.description: List of marketing event details to create or update

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the next page results.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

NextPage.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response
